Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Temple trust boards across Andhra Prades.description: VIJAYAWADA: Andhra Pradesh endowments minister Velampalli Srinivasa Rao said all the temple trust boards across the state including the trust board of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams will be dissolved through an ordinance soon. Velampalli Srinivas offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala temple during his maiden visit as the state endowments minister on Wednesday. Speaking to reporters at Tirumala, the minister said it had become inevitable for the government to dissolve all the temple trust boards constituted by the TDP government through an ordinance because most of the boards have not voluntarily come forward to step down despite a change of guard in the state . A decision to this effect was already taken during the recent cabinet meet, he added. Velampalli Srinivas said a review meeting would soon be held with the officials to review the security measures in place to safeguard the hoards of jewellery of Lord Venkateswara. Former MP Subba Reddy to take over as ch.description: VIJAYAWADA: Former MP Y V Subba Reddy is set to take over as TTD trust board chairman. Though chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy had already finalised the appointment of Subba Reddy, the announcement was delayed as incumbent Putta Sudhakar Yadav had refused to quit the post.  With Yadav resigning on Wednesday, Subba Reddy's elevation now looks only a formality. As some board members are still continuing in their posts even after the regime change in the state, the government is planning to issue orders to dissolve the TTD board and appoint Subba Reddy as its new chairman. The orders are expected in the next three-four days. "The chief minister is very clear on protecting the holiness of the temple and its premises," said Subba Reddy. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Plans to renovate \u2018spooked\u2019 Ga.description: VIJAYAWADA: A change in government has once again made renovation works at Gandhi Hill uncertain. The Andhra Pradesh tourism department, which was expected to complete the works by January 30, has not yet been able to complete the process of announcing and accepting tenders. Once a prime tourist destination in the city, Gandhi Hill has been struggling under monumental neglect for almost two decades now. Nothing but a few dilapidated structures stand atop the hill now. Members of Gandhi Hill foundation had been requesting the Andhra Pradesh tourism development corporation (APTDC) to save the tourist spot. Since Gandhi Hill is located next to Vijayawada railway station, APTDC noticed its potential and Rs 5 crore was sanctioned to facelift the planetarium and the library at Gandhi Hill. Also, for the first time in the country, a glow garden was going to come up on the hill. However, after the election, chief secretary LV Subramanyam ordered all departments that only investments that are grounded can proceed. Ones that aren’t grounded or are in tendering process have been halted. While the renovation works are almost completed for Gandhi Hill library, works for planetarium has now stopped. Activists who have been fighting for renovation of the second oldest planetarium in the country, afre upset as the works are stalled. Speaking to TOI, Abdul Azeez, a city-based activist pointed out, “for two years now, the planetarium that once attracted school children and tourists has been closed due to equipment failures. Over the years, a number of proposals like ropeway between Gandhi Hill to Indrakeeladri Hill and other renovations have been promised. None has been realised yet.” Residents of One-Town area recollect that Gandhi Hill was once considered as the best hang-out spot. Over the years, however, due to lack of maintenance, Gandhi Hill is now just a collection of ruins. Many even believe it to be haunted. “I have been a regular visitor to Gandhi Hill for 25 years now. The peaceful spot attracts me. But in recent times, it seems too unsafe a place to visit, especially in the evenings,” K Rama Rao, a resident of Chittinagar reminisced. Ex-min Acchannaidu protests downsizing o.description: AMARAVATI: In protest against downsizing of security, former minister K Acchannaidu has refused to accept security cover. He sent away the gunman who reported to duty on Wednesday. The former minister has lodged a complaint with DGP Gautam Sawang on downsizing of security. He said there was no need of security for him if the police felt that there was no threat to his life. As a cabinet minister, Achhannaidu had an eight-member security team along with pilot and escort vehicles. His security was lowered from 4+4 gunmen after TDP lost power. After reviewing threat perception, the intelligence wing recommended 2+2 security for the former minister. The government however allocated him only 1+1 gunman from Wednesday. Expressing displeasure, Achhannaidu moved around the city without any security. Achhannaidu is TDP’s deputy floor leader in the assembly and playing a key role in taking on YSRCP in the assembly. The government has downsized or removed security cover to former legislators and legislators of TDP in the last two weeks. “It is a routine process to assess threat perception on different leaders from time to time and allocate security personnel. All former legislators do not require security,” said a senior police official. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No more huff and puff; forests, gardens.description: Amaravati: The state goverment is keen upon adding more urban forests to bring down temperatures in the major cities of the state. Forests and environment minister Balineni Srinivasa Reddy promised this on Wednesday and added that the government is planning to spend close to Rs 54.30 crore to create urban forests and eco-tourism centres. Speaking to reporters in the secretariat, the minister also pointed out that all vacancies in the department will soon be filled. Balineni said that there are 12 urban forests in the state already and six more urban forests would be created spending Rs 30 crore. On the other hand, Rs 22.3 crore would be spent on developing eco-tourism centres. Urban forests, the minister said, would held people in the cities breathe a cleaner air. Also, as many as six botanical gardens would be set up. As a step to increase greenery in the cities, 25 crore saplings will be planted thie year. Funds of Rs 175 crore from NREGS will be spent for planting saplings. While speaking on vacancies in the department, Balineni said that 2,766 spots would be filled. He said that the government had already taken up measures to fill 504 vacancies through APPSC. Balineni went on to speak on elephant attacks in the state as well and promised that the government would give out Rs 5 lakh as compensation to the kin of the elephant attack victims. The government would pay Rs 6,000 for every acre of crop destroyed by elephants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman burns lover, cousin alive in Telan.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 50-year-old woman was burnt alive by her cousin at Sanathnagar on Wednesday morning. An autorickshaw driver Khaleel too suffered severe burn injuries in the incident and succumbed late in the evening. The deceased woman was identified as Hajinissa. Khaleel was Hajinissa’s brother. According to Penamaluru inspector V Peddiraju, the 50-year-old accused Nafeesa (name changed) had been in an alleged extra-marital affair with her brother-in-law Khaleel for five years. Over the years, Nafeesa grew jealous of Khaleel’s wife and decided to kill her. The incident took place around 9am after Nafeesa’s husband Karim left for work. Nafeesa then walked into Khaleel’s room and found him sleeping next to a woman whom she assumed to be his wife. However, it was Hajnissa who was sleeping next to Khaleel. Nafeesa doused Hajinissa with petrol and set her ablaze. In the process, Khaleel, too, suffered heavy burn injuries Investigation revealed that Nafeesa was angry that Khaleel had been avoiding her in the recent past and decided to take the extreme measure. “In order to avoid any family disputes, Khaleel had been distancing himself from Nafeesa,” Peddiraju told TOI.  Khaleel was taken to Vijayawada government general hospital (GGH) where he died around 8.30pm. A case under section 302 of IPC (murder) was registered against Nafeesa. Fire claims one life, burns down 13 huts.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 65-year-old man was burnt alive after his thatched hut caught fire while he was sleeping inside. The fire took place in Kammanamolu village under Nagayalanka mandal in Krishna district at 1.30am on Thursday. Thirteen houses were gutted in the incident. The deceased was identified as L Gopala Krishna who was alone in his hut. Fire tenders battled the flames for almost an hour. Fire officials explained that the incident took place because of an earthing problem leading to a short circuit. The thatched roofs caught fire easily and soon the flames spread to the nearby houses. The lucky few spotted the fire and fled from the spot. According to sources, the fire got out of control since there was a delay in fire tenders reaching the spot. Locals had contacted the nearest fire station at Avanigadda which is about 15km away from the village. However, since there were no fire personnel in the station, the message had to be relayed to Movva fire station which is 43km away from the scene of the fire. Locals claim that property worth around Rs 15 lakh was burnt down in the incident. Fire officials, however, claim that all the thatched huts were using unsafe and unauthorised electricity hooked from a nearby electric pole. A case under Section 174 of CrPC (unnatural death) was registered at Nagayalanka police station. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Andhra Pradesh becomes first in India to.description: VIJAYAWADA: The Andhra Pradesh police department has become the first in the country to give weekly offs to its personnel. From Wednesday itself, all personnel from constable to inspector ranks will start getting offs. Director general of police (DGP) Gautam Sawang ordered this after a meeting with the committee constituted to formulate guidelines on weekly offs. This comes in spite of the fact that the police department is facing a severe staff crunch. There is about 20% staff shortage in the department. The committee, headed by additional director general of police Ravishankar Ayyannar, gave its report with 19 alternative plans that will fit various units like intelligence, CID, SPF and greyhounds. The unit heads can choose any plan depending upon their convenience, said Ayyannar. While some states have earlier tried to implement weekly offs, they have been limited to pilot projects only. With implementation of weekly offs, cumulative staff crunch in the department will be 30 per cent as one-seventh of the staff will be off duties. Ayyannar went on to say that an IT dashboard will be created to monitor the weekly offs in all districts and special units from the DGP’s office. The system will be reviewed after a month to deal with the problems that arise in implementation. Police officers’ associations across the state welcomed the decision. Srinivasa Rao, president of Andhra Pradesh police officers’ association thanked chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy and the DGP for implementing the weekly offs. He said that they have been waiting for this for two decades. Jaganmohan Reddy had made weekly offs to police personnel a part of his election promises. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

TDP will be emptied in a week: BJP leade.description: AMARAVATI: Upping the ante, state BJP leaders on Thursday declared that TDP will be emptied by the time Chandrababu Naidu returns from his foreign holiday. GVL Narasimha Rao, the party’s Rajya Sabha member, said many more leaders were in touch with them and the party will take a decision in due course. “We are not luring anyone to join our party. It’s due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi Ji that many leaders want to join BJP and work for the nation,” said GVL, adding that they would welcome leaders from other political parties to strengthen their base but would not disclose the names of those who are keen to join the party. BJP state vice-president S Vishnuvardhan Reddy said many TDP MLAs are in touch with BJP and would join the party before Naidu returns from his holiday. “Many might not stay with Naidu by the time he returns home from foreign tour. TDP is going to be emptied in a week,” thundered Vishnuvardhan Reddy. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Amma Vodi benefits only for govt schools.description: AMARAVATI: Clearing the air about the Amma Vodi scheme, education minister Adimulapu Suresh has said that in the first phase, the scheme will be implemented only in the government schools. While assuming charge as minister in the secretariat on Thursday, Suresh promised that the government would completely revamp the public education system in a few years. Earlier, there were talks that the Amma Vodi scheme would be extended to both government and private schools. Suresh said that the government would take a call on extending the scheme to private schools after studying the situation. In the first phase, therefore, only government schools will get the benefit. The minister warned that they would not hesitate to take action against the private schools if they try to lure students in the name of Amma Vodi. He went on to say that the scheme was introduced to reduce the dropout rate and help poor parents send their wards to schools. Suresh, however, said that they are open to extending the scheme to private schools but only after consultations with experts. “We are committed to strengthen the government schools first. We will introduce English medium branches alongside Telugu medium in all the schools to improve our enrolments,” assured the minister. He added that they have also taken a decision to abolish the 20 per cent internal assessment marks being awarded for the SSC students. He said that the government has noticed that only private schools were getting benefitted from the internal assessment marks and hence has decided to do away with the system. The government would definitely regulate the fees in corporate schools and colleges, Suresh promised. According to him, a committee has been appointed to make suitable recommendations so that fees can be regulates atprivate educational institutions. Suresh pointed out further that he had cleared the long-pending issue of granting promotions to school teachers and that about 19,000 teachers would get benefit of promotions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

At secret meeting, Kapu leaders mull the.description: KAKINADA: As four of TDP's six Rajya Sabha MPs switched over to the BJP, 14 of the party's former MLAs and top Kapu leaders met here on Thursday to chart out their future course. Kapus are numerically strong in East and West Godavari districts and whichever party won the majority of seats in the Godavari belt has always formed the state government. The YSRCP bagged most of the seats in Godavari districts in the recent assembly polls and the Kapu leaders in the TDP took stock of the political situation post elections. Even as the meeting was being held, four of the TDP MPs in the Rajya Sabha had joined the BJP in New Delhi. The Kapu leaders will meet again to decide on the future course of action, sources said. According to sources, the TDP Kapu leaders met under the leadership of former MLA Thota Thrimurthulu in a hotel in Kakinada. Though the meeting was kept secret, visuals of the deliberations went viral on social media. Kapu leaders from Krishna district too attended the meeting that lasted for about four hours.  Though the leaders later told media that the meeting was convened to analyse the reasons for the defeat of the TDP in the assembly and the Lok Sabha elections, sources said they discussed about the need to join the BJP. Some leaders expressed the view that joining the ruling YSRCP would be a better option. Sources said the TDP leaders have been in constant touch with the BJP top leadership in Delhi. Senior BJP leader Ram Madhav incidentally hails East Godavari district. Thursday's meeting is said to be in continuation of the individual confabulations the Kapu leaders had with the BJP's central leadership. Madhav is reportedly in touch with some of the Kapu leaders as part of the grand plans to expand the BJP's base in AP. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Easy redressal: Fire attendance docus no.description: Vijayawada: City residents will now have an easier deal while applying for insurance after a fire accident. An online service to issue fire attendance certificate to the public was launched at the headquarters of the state disaster response and fire services department on Wendesday. The fire attendance certificate is necessary to claim insurance funds after a fire. Principal secretary of home KRM Kishore Kumar inaugurated the service. Addressing the media at the event, director general of fire services K Satyanarayana explained that earlier, people had to fill up applications manually to get the attendance certificates, which was a cumbersome process. “Now, anyone can sit at their home and use their computers to apply for the fire attendance certificate online, download and print the copy of the system-generated fire attendance certificate,” Satyanarayana said. Not just holders of residential properties, even those of industries can apply for the certificate online. The no-objection certificates are already available online. “Digitisation would automatically reduce corruption in the department as officials won’t have much of an interactive role with the applicants,” Satyanarayana said. Explaining other upcoming upgrades to the department, Satyanarayana explained that more fire stations are being constructed and the much-awaited fire station office has already been constructed in Visakhapatnam, ready to be inaugurated soon by the home minister. He also said that a district fire office in Kakinada is coming up. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NRI murdered sons, wife before shooting.description: VIJAYAWADA: Police on Tuesday confirmed that NRI Chandrasekhar Sunkara, who was found shot dead in Iowa, US, with his wife and sons on Saturday, had indeed committed suicide. Unofficial sources say, Chandrasekhar had killed his wife and sons before shooting himself. West Des Moines police released an update on their Facebook page confirming the suicide and said that they are treating the other deaths as homicides without pressing any charges as of now. Dallas county sheriff Chad Leonard issued a statement to a local website saying that Chandrasekhar was issued a permit to carry weapons in April. Leonard also stated that at least one weapon was purchased after the permit was issued but they are yet to ascertain when the weapon was purchased and where. It has been revealed that the two guests who were staying at Sunkara’s residence were Chandrasekhar’s in-laws.   On Saturday morning, Chandrasekhar’s wife Lavanya (41) and the couple's sons Prabhas (14) and Suhas (10) were all killed in their sleep. Cops said that the in-laws had first tried to call 911 but could not communicate and then ran outside and requested the neighbours to make the call in their stead. “Unofficially, it has been found that Chandrasekhar killed his wife and two children. The in-laws heard the first gunshot but Chandrasekhar said that it was some cracker in the neighbourhood. Later, three more gunshots were heard by the elderly couple,” president of Telugu Association of North America (TANA) Satish Vemana said. Cops, however, have declined to comment about what could have motivated the killings or suicide. Meanwhile, the last rites of the Sunkara family took place at Caldwell parish funeral home at Urbandale in Iowa on Tuesday morning. Satish explained that the cremation took place in US as the in-laws did not want the bodies to be taken to India. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PCA could be answer for a city facing wa.description: Visakhapatnam: With the city facing a water crisis every year, adopting water-saving technology and making sustainable use of water is becoming increasingly important. One of the techniques, which seems to be gaining in popularity in the city is the use of Pressure Compensating Aerator (PCA). While people residing in areas like Kirlampudi layout, Siripuram, have already adopted the technology, the Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation has also adopted the same. Apart from a few private companies, hospitals and hotels in the city, the Navy house and naval quarters have also come forward to use the technology. Speaking to TOI, GVMC commissioner, M Hari Narayanan, said, “We have adopted this technology in the GVMC building and it is a good initiative towards sustainable use of water. Small drops make an ocean; hence this initiative will go a long way in the future.” Similarly, Uday Shirname, president of Kirlampudi Layout RWA and AP Federation of RWAs, said, “We have installed the water nozzles with this technology in all the main water points in every flat of our building and the result is surprising. 40%-50% of the water can be saved without compromising on the comfort level. Other buildings in my colony have also followed the same. The nozzles are cheap and easy to install.” Speaking about the technology’s effectiveness, the business head of a private company, which sells the product said “Unlike countries like Singapore, there is no regulatory mechanism to control pressure of water in the country. Hence, a lot of water goes waste. “The water discharge in Litres Per Minute (LPM) while washing hands is around 9-12 LPM. But the PCA technology helps in saving 80% water as it comes down to 2 LPM. Similarly, the LPM for showerheads is 20-25 LPM but if the technology is adopted, the LPM reduces it to nine. Depending on the usage of water every minute, more than 50% of water can be saved in every household and office.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

India Pakistan news.description: NEW DELHI/ISLAMABAD: India dismissed on Thursday as "fake news" the suggestion in Pak media that it was looking to resume talks with the hostile neighbour and asserted that there was no dilution of its position that Islamabad needed to take verifiable and irreversible action against terrorism for the dialogue to resume. Responding to Pakistan PM Imran Khan's congratulatory letter after he assumed office for the second time, PM Narendra Modi wrote back on June 12 expressing India's desire to have normal and cooperative relations with all its neighbours, including Pakistan, while stressing that "for this, it is important to build an environment of trust, free of terror, violence and hostility". Foreign minister S Jaishankar also wrote to his Pakistani counterpart S M Qureshi, again only in response to the latter's congratulatory letter, emphasising the need for an atmosphere "free from the shadow of terror and violence". The emphasis on the need for Pakistan to rein in terror as a pre-condition for re-engagement was in keeping with the stand which saw Modi refrain from engaging with Imran Khan at the just-concluded SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan. Yet, the Pakistani media chose to interpret the contents of the letters of Modi and Jaishankar as reflecting India's desire to re-engage. The foreign ministry in Delhi quickly scotched the suggestion. "There was complete distortion and an attempt to peddle fake news (in the way it was reported). The letters only reiterated India's old position that it wants normal and cooperative relations with all countries in South Asia and that it was important to create an environment free of terror and violence for it. There was no mention of any sort of dialogue with Pakistan," said MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar, adding that India will not be fooled by any cosmetic action against terror by Islamabad. Emphasising that both the letters were written in as per the "established diplomatic practice", Kumar said: "In their messages, they have highlighted that India seeks normal and cooperative relations with all neighbours, including Pakistan." In his letter, Modi had said that India remained committed to operationalising early an "all-year-round" Kartarpur corridor. Touching upon it, Kumar said India had already held three technical-level discussions with Pakistan and was currently awaiting clarification from Islamabad over a few issues it had raised. Puzzlingly, later in the evening, Pakistan's foreign ministry, which had kept quiet through the day, also sought to play down the speculation about the import of the letters. While responding to a question, the spokesperson said, "It was an established practice for the leadership to congratulate new office holders and for them to respond." "Pakistan's position on the way forward in relations with India was clear and well-known and did not require repetition," said the spokesperson, adding that the "vision of peace, progress and prosperity of South Asia could be advanced by peacefully resolving all outstanding disputes, including Jammu & Kashmir, and moving away from dynamic of confrontation to cooperation". Earlier in the day, sources in the Pakistan foreign office had said that Modi and Jaishankar had responded positively to recent letters from their Pakistani counterparts by conveying New Delhi's desire to engage with all countries, including Pakistan, for elimination of terrorism and prosperity of the region. "India has always prioritised peace and human development, and sought to maintain cordial relations with all regional powers," Modi and Jaishankar maintained, according to FO sources. Both leaders, according to FO sources, called for special attention on elimination of terrorism in the region and said the issue must be a core focus in all future talks. They have also appreciated sentiments from Pakistan in their letters, the FO sources added. Modi's letter was in response to a congratulatory letter from Khan in which he had underscored Pakistan's vision of working for "durable peace and stability in South Asia with peaceful resolution of all outstanding disputes, including J&K". Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Vijayawada 78th most polluted in world,.description: VIJAYAWADA: Vijayawada is the 78th most polluted city in the world and 55th most polluted city in the continent, according to a pollution survey. In last five years, Vijayawada’s pollution score has worsened from 63 to 72 in the global pollution index. While the city does not outrank metros like Chennai, Bengaluru, Mumbai or Delhi, it stands at the sixth place among two-tier cities in the country. In 2014, Vijayawada stood at 111th place in the pollution index. While the city is certainly not as polluted as Delhi, its pollution level is ranked ‘extremely high’. However, Vijayawada has a lesser greenery in comparison with Delhi. The global pollution index publishes its findings on a real-time basis based upon scores given by residents of a particular city. Apart from air quality, residents of Vijayawada gave the city the lowest scores in garbage disposal systems and general comfort. Vijayawada is worse off than Visakhapatnam which achieved a score of 68.01 and was ranked 106th globally. Other two-tier cities which have ranked better than Vijayawada include Pune, Ahmedabad, Dehradun, Madurai, Thane, Nagpur, Vadodara, Coimbatore and Indore. The least polluted two-tier city in India is Mangalore which secured the 263rd place in the global pollution index. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) had recently announced that all five major cities of the state— Vijayawada, Visakhapatnam, Guntur, Kurnool and Nellore are ‘non-attainment areas’ and fall short of ambient air quality standards according to Ambient Air Quality India (2011-15) and WHO. Experts opine that burning of garbage, construction-related activities and increase in vehicular pollution in Vijayawada, after Amaravati was declared the state capital, has led to the increase in PM-10 levels. The pollution survey was done by Numbeo.com. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jagan attends all-party meet, backs PM\u.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy joined the all-party meeting convened by Prime Minister Narendra Modi to discuss the concept of ‘one nation, one election’, in the national capital on Wednesday. Though some opposition parties, including the Congress and its allies in the UPA, boycotted the meeting, YSR Congress from AP and TRS from Telangana attended the meeting. While Jagan represented YSRC, K T Rama Rao represented the TRS as its working president, as party president and chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao is busy monitoring arrangements for the inauguration of the Kaleswaram project in his state on June 21. Sources said Jagan responded positively to the concept of joint elections for Parliament and state assemblies proposed by the PM. However, it was decided to form an expert committee to study the proposal. PM Modi will pick the names for the committee, and sources indicate that a YSRC nominee would find a place in the panel. The issue has been raised by the PM to cut down on expenditure in the elections, besides avoiding polls in one state or the other in the country at varying intervals. Jagan also welcomed the proposals to celebrate the 150th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi and 75 years of Independence in the coming years. The YSR Congress would be a part of these celebrations which would be organized by the central government. On the occasion, the chief minister requested the Centre to increase central funds for backward districts of the state. The chief minister sought to draw the attention of the Prime Minister that the four Rayalaseema and three north Andhra districts were promised special package at the time of bifurcation. However, these districts were not given their due funds as promised in the last five years, and appealed to the PM to release the funds. YSRC, which has 22 MPs in the Lok Sabha, has agreed to cooperate with the government in the healthy functioning of the Parliament. Meanwhile, on his arrive in the national capital, Jagan travelled by Delhi metro from the airport to the Parliament house, where the meeting was convened. He was accompanied by senior officials and party MPs. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NIA opposes bail to Jagan attacker, move.description: Vijayawada: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) moved the high court on Wednesday against the granting of bail to J Srinivasa Rao, the accused in the attack on chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy at Visakhapatnam airport last year. The NIA has challenged the decision of the special NIA court, which granted bail to Srinivasa Rao recently. The NIA argued that the special court, while granting bail to Srinivasa Rao, did not give any reasons. The Suppression of Unlawful Acts against Safety of Civil Aviation Act mandates to give reasons while granting bail to the accused, according to section 6A of the Act. However, the NIA court did not consider this while granting bail to the accused, the NIA stated in its plea, while adding that though a charge sheet has been filed, their investigation is yet to be completed. Giving bail to the accused while the investigation is underway could hamper its progress, argued Sidda Ramulu, the NIA counsel. Countering the argument, Matta Jayakar, the counsel for Srinivas Rao, said the accused is not a terrorist or extremist. He further argued that no one knows exactly what happened on that day as no CCTV footage is available. Also, the NIA has stated in the lower court that they are filing a final charge sheet. As it has also been filed, there is no reason to reject bail to the accused, he argued. However, the high court bench headed by chief justice C Praveen Kumar asked Jayakar’s stand on section 6A, to which he sought one week’s time. Accepting his request, the high court posted the matter to be heard again on June 26. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CM Jagan sets 2021 target for Polavaram.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy set June 2021 as new target to complete the Polavaram Project. The CM visited the project site on Thursday and took an aerial view of the project before landing. He then looked at a pictorial display of the project progress and interacted with officials on the progress of the works, the quality of the works and the other issues including rehabilitation, resettlement and compensation to the land acquired for the project. Jagan told the officials and the contractors that he would monitor the work and would not compromise on quality. Engineers told the CM that project would be completed by February 2021, while hydraulic power project required another ten months. On rehabilitation, resettlement and compensation, Jagan made it clear that no family should suffer loss. He told the officials to protect the interests of those who offered land for the project. He said the relief and rehabilitation package should be implemented in its full extent as guided in the 2013 Act.  Later,minister for irrigation Anil Kumar Yadav said an expert committee will audit the project works completed during the TDP regime. He said the government would look into every aspect of the project and would not leave anyone indulged in corruption. He said the CM had hinted at investigating into corruption of the previous government in payments to contractors and compensation to people. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kapu leaders\u2019 meeting in Kakinada m.description: Kakinada: In a major jolt to TDP, 14 of its former MLAs and top Kapu leaders met here on Thursday and discussed options of joining BJP or YSR Congress. Kapus are numerically strong in East and West Godavari districts and whichever party has won the majority of seats in the Godavari belt has always formed the state government. YSRCP bagged most of the seats in the Godavari districts in the recent assembly polls and the Kapu leadership in TDP took stock of the political situation post-elections. Even as the meeting was being held, four of the TDP MPs in the Rajya Sabha had joined BJP in New Delhi. The Kapu leaders will meet again to decide on the future course of action, sources said. According to sources, Kapu leaders met under the chairmanship of former MLA Thota Trimurthulu in a hotel in Kakinada town. Though the meeting was kept a secret, visuals of the deliberations circulated in social media groups. Kapu leaders from Krishna district too attended the meeting that lasted for about four hours. Prominent Kapu leaders present were Bonda Uma, Badeti Bujji, B Vedavyas, Chengalrayudu, Jyothula Nehru, Madhava Naidu, Eli Nani, Meesala Geetha, Varupula Raju, KA Naidu and Panchakarla Ramesh Babu. Though the leaders later told media that the meeting was convened to analyse reasons for the defeat of TDP in the assembly and the Lok Sabha elections, sources said they discussed the need to join BJP. Some expressed the view that the YSRCP would be a better option. The meeting gained significance as TDP president and former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu is away on a family vacation in Europe. Sources said TDP leaders have been in constant touch with the BJP top leadership in New Delhi. Senior BJP leader Ram Madhav is, incidentally, from East Godavari district. Thursday’s meeting is said to be in continuation of the individual confabulations the Kapu leaders had with the BJP central leadership. Ram Madhav is reportedly in touch with some of the TDP Kapu leaders as part of the grand plans to expand BJP’s base in AP. BJP hopes that it can emerge as a strong political alternative to YSRCP in Andhra Pradesh. As the news of the secret meeting spread, Naidu spoke with some of the party leaders and advised them against taking any hasty decision. Thota Trimurthulu later told media that the meeting was held to discuss the problems of the Kapu community, besides exploring the reasons for TDP’s debacle in the assembly polls. He said the meeting was held in a hotel and not in the TDP district office as all the invitees hailed from one community. He said the leaders did not discuss leaving TDP. 17-year-old hangs self in hostel bath.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 17-year-old student hanged herself in her hostel bathroom after a fight with her friends at Pedapalakaru village in Guntur on late Wednesday night. The deceased was identified as Gudapati Sasi, an Intermediate second year student from Guttavaripalem village. According to Nallapadu police inspector Veeraswami, Sasi was depressed after some of her friends suspected that she had stolen cash from a friend’s bag. Two days ago, Sasi slept at a friend’s room and the next day, the latter found some cash to be missing. Suspecting that Sasi might have taken it, a group of girls went ahead and checked Sasi’s bags on Wednesday. Feeling insulted, Sasi took the extreme step, said the cops. The body was discovered on Thursday morning after students found the bathroom door locked from the inside for a long period. Cops sent the body for postmortem. A case under Section 174 of CrPC (death by hanging) has been registered. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Kullu road accident.description: MANALI: At least 44 people have died and 29 sustained injured on Thursday when a bus fell into a gorge in Himachal's Kullu district. Kullu superintendent of police (SP) Shalini Agnihotri said several women and kids were among the injured. The vehicle had started its journey from the Banjar bus stand around 4pm and covered barely 2km when it met with an accident. The driver apparently lost control while negotiating a sharp turn at the Bhiyoth Mor, which has a gradient of more than 75 degrees. Eyewitnesses said the bus veered off the road to scrape the mountain face before hurtling down the gorge. Local residents and police personnel faced difficulty locating and extricating the bodies from the mangled mass of metal. Parts of the vehicle were strewn over a wide swathe of the bottom of the gorge. Between 2009 and 2018, Himachal Pradesh recorded 30,993 road accidents in which 11,561 people were killed and 53,909 injured. This year alone, as many as 430 people died in 1,168 road accidents in the state till May 31. In Video:Several killed as bus falls into gorge in Himachal Pradesh's KulluDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Cold storage fire: Crops, property of Rs.description: TIRUPATI: Crops and property worth more than Rs 3 crore were destroyed after a fire broke out at a private cold storage unit near Bollavaram village of Kurnool district on Tuesday. According to district fire officer G Srinivasa Reddy, the fire was spotted at Srichakra cold storage unit at around 5am. “Gas leakage and short circuit is likely to have triggered the fire,” he said. The watchman on duty spotted the fire and immediately alerted his bosses, who in turn informed the local fire services department. It took four fire tenders four long hours to bring the raging fire under control. By then, the damage was done. Agricultural produce including paddy, red gram and dried chilli, besides property was completely gutted. No casualties, however, were reported. The fire officer said a case has been registered and investigation is on to ascertain the cause of the fire. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Fake currency kingpin nabbed.description: VIJAYAWADA: A government employee was arrested from his residence at Chirala town of Prakasam on Thursday for allegedly printing and circulating fake notes. The accused David Raju is a junior assistant at Chirala RTC depot. Recently, two vendors Koppala Appa Rao and Kopanadhi Bithyala Verma were arrested for possessing counterfeit currency close to Rs 3 lakh. However, cops said that they did not print the cash and were only circulating them. Based on information provided by the two, it was found that Raju was behind the whole racket. Counterfeit currency worth Rs 13 lakh was seized from Raju with the equipment used for printing. Raju was mostly printing notes of Rs 100 or Rs 50 and slipped the notes between two original notes in order to avoid suspicion. He used to sell fake currency worth Rs 3 lakh for Rs 30,000. Raju was sent to judicial custody. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Garikapati falls ill, rushed to hospital.description: AMARAVATI: TDP’s Rajya Sabha member Garikapati Rammohan Rao suddenly fell ill inside the Parliament on Thursday, and was rushed to Ram Manohar Lohia hospital where he is recovering. Garikapati felt uneasy while walking towards the Rajya Sabha chairman’s chamber in the afternoon. Fellow MPs Sujana Chowdary and C M Ramesh, who were close by, immediately took him to the hospital. Low blood pressure is said to be the reason behind his sudden uneasiness. Garikapati is among the four TDP MPs who are tipped to quit the party and join BJP. Sources said the MPs were, in fact, going to meet Rajya Sabha chairman and Vice-President Venkaiah Naidu to discuss the issue. A native of Warangal district in Telangana state, Garikapati became a RS member in 2014. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

State to spend Rs 764 crore to buy 350 e.description: AMARAVATI: In a major push to eco-friendly public transport, public carrier APSRTC will shortly procure 350 electric buses. The electric buses will ply in Vijayawada, Amaravati, Visakhapatnam, Tirupati and Kakinada on a pilot basis. Transport minister Perni Venkatramaiah (Nani) assumed charge in the secretariat on Thursday. Speaking to media, the minister pointed out that the government has decided to spend Rs 764 crore to buy electric buses. He said each bus would cost Rs 2.18 crore. “We are readying a comprehensive plan to bring APSRTC out of red. We will phase out diesel vehicles after seeing the performance of electric vehicles,” said the minister. He said they have sought Rs 187.5 crore from the Centre under Fame scheme. He said APSRTC is incurring huge losses due to frequent rise in diesel prices. He said they have appointed a high-level committee to look into issues for the merger of APSRTC into government. He said the government was committed to make APSRTC a profitable entity by introducing reforms. The minister said they were re-introducing temporary registration of vehicles at RTO offices and that granting registration at dealer point is helping the dealers mint more money. Similarly, vehicle users could apply for learner’s licences in RTO offices henceforth, said Nani. Meanwhile, the minister signed on a file to facilitate differently-abled people renew their APSRTC bus passes once in three months. As per present rules, they have to renew their passes every month. The minister said that nearly 2.5 lakh differently-abled people would benefit from the new rule. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

No vote, no road: Andhra political battl.description: VIJAYAWADA: The rivalry between YSR Congress and Telugu Desam Party in Andhra Pradesh has taken a bizarre turn in two villages. On Wednesday, YSRCP workers in a village in Guntur constructed a wall across a road to prevent TDP workers from using it. In another incident, YSRCP workers in Prakasam district dug up a cement road laid by the previous TDP government about 10 months ago alleging that the people using the road had not voted for YSRCP in the assembly polls. The police had to intervene in both villages to maintain law and order. A picket was posted at Ponugupadu village of Phirangipuram mandal in Guntur district where a three-feet wall was raised blocking the village thoroughfare. Since incident has a caste angle, the police held a peace meeting between the rival TDP and YSRCP groups. A majority of TDP supporters are from an upper caste, while YSRC supporters belong to Scheduled Castes. YSRC supporters have claimed the wall was built to prevent encroachment by TDP men as the land used for the road was on private property, but TDP supporters maintained the road belonged to revenue department and was been used for the last 80 years. Phirangipuram SI D Srihari said the claims have been referred to the revenue department and in the meantime the area has been kept out of bounds for public. Political workers dig up cement roadEarlier, there have been incidents of demolition of flag posts and party arches and attacks on political opponents in Narasaraopet, Sattenapalli, Macherla and Gurazala assembly constituencies in Guntur. These constituencies fall under Palnadu region, once known for its faction feuds. In the other incident at Uppalapadu village in Kanigiri assembly constituency in Prakasam district, a cement road was dug up with an excavator. The road was laid at Muslim Colony around 10 months ago. The road was dug up as the residents allegedly supported the TDP candidate in the just-concluded assembly elections. A complaint has been lodged with the police. Meanwhile, the situation at Manchikallu, Pinnelli, Machavaram Mutyalampadu and Tangeda villages turned serious as local TDP leaders fled fearing attacks. About 70 families in Pinnelli supported the TDP in the recent elections. They are taking shelter at Gamalapadu near Dachepalli. They met Guntur rural SP seeking protection. As many as 15 cases have been registered in Narasaraopet, Sattenapalli and Gurazala police sub-divisions since election results. A little over 40 people were injured in clashes after the polls. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. 275 excise constables promoted.description: Vijayawada: As many as 275 constables working in the prohibition and excise department were promoted by the state to the post of head constables. To make way for the promotions, constable cadre strength has been reduced from 3,405 to 3,130. Accordingly, the head constable posts were increased from 697 to 972. Prohibition and excise department commissioner had requested the government for an upgradation of posts based on the requirements of the department.. Orders have also been issued to temporarily promote two assistant superintendent ranked officers to superintendent rank. N Annapurna and A Avulaiah were promoted to the superintendent rank (subject to the outcome of liquor syndicate cases). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Vijayawada: Man burnt alive in fire mish.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 60-year-old man was charred to death in a fire mishap at Kammenamola village of Nagayalanka mandal in Krishna district during the wee hours of Thursday. The deceased was identified as L Gopala Swamy. According to District Fire Officer (DFO) D Niranjan Reddy, the blaze started around 2.30am due to a suspected short circuit in the village. As many as eight hutments were gutted in the mishap. The victim, who was sleeping inside one of the huts, could not escape and was burnt alive. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tree crushes 6-year-old in Tenali school.description: Vijayawada: A six-year-old boy died after a tree fell on him inside his school premises. The incident took place at Marichupet in Tenali on Wednesday. The deceased was identified as Bhimavarapu Sandeep Reddy, a class one student at the government municipal primary school. After school hours, Sandeep was waiting for his elder brother to leave for home when the eucalyptus tree under which he was standing collapsed, crushing him. He was taken to Tenali government hospital but the doctors declared him brought dead. However, no physical injuries other than a fractured leg were there on his body. Tenali three town inspector B Harikrishna said that doctors were suspecting internal injuries and shock might have caused the boy’s death. A case under Section 174 of CrPC has been registered by the cops. The inspector went on to say that the trunk of the tree was rendered weak by insects and the accident could take place at any time. Naidu, family take week-long European br.description: Amaravati: Former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu, who skipped the all-party meet in New Delhi, went on an European holiday along with his family on Wednesday. Naidu, his wife Bhuvaneswari, son Lokesh, son-in-law Brahmani and grandson Devansh took the flight from the Rajiv Gandhi international airport in Hyderabad. However, no details were available on which nations Naidu will tour during the week-long trip. Though the TDP chief wanted to take the break after his party’s election debacle, he postponed the trip in view of the assembly session. After the session got over, his family reached Hyderabad late on Tuesday night and took the flight to Europe on Wednesday. The TDP chief, who rarely goes holidaying, was persuaded by son Lokesh to take a break from regular political activity and spend time with the family. His last overseas trip with family members was in 2015, when he visited Turkey. In the last three years, he didn’t take a break due to hectic government and party activities.
